remarks: Express a two-argument function as a one-argument function, or vice-versa.  In this version ` A ( y ) ` is not assumed to be constant w.r.t ` y ` , analogous to ~ mpt2mptx .  (Contributed by AV, 30-Mar-2019.)
statement:
mpt2mptx2.1 $e |- ( z = <. x , y >. -> C = D ) $.
mpt2mptx2 $p |- ( z e. U_ y e. B ( A X. { y } ) |-> C ) = ( x e. A , y e. B |-> D ) $.
$d A x z $.
$d B x z $.
$d C x y $.
$d D z $.
$d y z $.
